p:
Concerning the strains found in the Risaralda and Cauca Andean area, the T3308C (aa. nsp2-Y543H), G3840C (aa. nsp2-G720A) and T5445C (aa. nsP3-L458P) mutations demonstrate their phylogenetic relationship with the Nicaraguan strain (Figs 3, 4). In a previous study, it was determined that the Nicaraguan strain was closely related to the strain of British Virgin Islands
31 . In contrast, our study showed that strain BVI KJ451624 has a relationship to Mexican strain (Fig. 2). BVI KJ451624 strain was one of the first to appear in the outbreak in January 2014 in the Caribbean islands; it is possible that the strains of CHIKV mutated in their movement from Sant Martin December 2013, British Virgin Islands, Mexico, Nicaragua, and Colombia, where the mutations were detected.
